page.title: 16Fishing in the Spey
page.content: { The River Spey}is considered to be one of the{best fishing rivers}in the country. Its superb fishing brings thousands of tourists and holidaymakers every year to Grantown. The most sought after fish is the {salmon -}its{season}lasts from{11th {Feb. to 30th Sept.}with its peak in September.{Trout}season is{15th March {till 6th Oct,}reaching its peak May/June. Each year, every fisherman on the Spey aims to catch either the first salmon of the season or the biggest. So far in{1985}the{biggest}fish caught weighed{26lb.}The biggest fish caught in{recent years}weighed{48lb. In 1984, the river was low and fishing was bad. As a result there were fewer holidaymakers. Shops and hotels lost trade. Grantown depends a great deal on its river.
